poem:
**Refinements in Tone**

A palette blooms  
for skin's deeper shades—  
no more echoes of ash  
mourning beauty's truth.  
  
Science, in its gentle sweep,  
stirs the redness,  
kindles warmth,  
infuses life into  
hues once grey.  
A revelation,  
a whisper of love,  
paints newfound grace  
across boundless faces.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Researchers solve mystery of makeup appearing ashy or grey on darker skin Researchers believe they have found a solution to makeup for darker skin tones often appearing ashy or grey once applied. In recent years the market for beauty products designed for people with darker skin tones has boomed, with some brands now offering consumers a huge variety of shades. Now researchers say they have found a way to create redder tones in makeup for". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
